abstract: Over the past year, the city has added just 40,100 jobs in the private sector, for a slower rate of growth than the rest of the state and the nation since September 2010.
snippet: Over the past year, the city has added just 40,100 jobs in the private sector, for a slower rate of growth than the rest of the state and the nation since September 2010.
lead_paragraph: Even with the return of more than 8,000 Verizon workers who had been striking, New York City did not add enough jobs last month to lower the unemployment rate, which remained at 8.7 percent, the State Department of Labor reported on Thursday.
